channel.title: garbage-collection on minidump.net
channel.description: Recent content in garbage-collection on minidump.net

item.title: Exploring .NET frozen segments
item.description: Exploring a little-known API allowing to allocate managed objects outside of the managed heap.

item.title: Memory alignment of doubles in C#
item.description: A deep dive into the weird tricks used by the .NET allocator to align arrays of doubles.

item.title: SuppressGCTransition
item.description: Deep-dive into the SuppressGCTransition attribute introduced in .NET 5.

item.title: Monitor GC stats with a startup hook
item.description: Using startup hooks to automatically fetch GC metrics from any .net core application.

item.title: Check what .net core GC keywords are enabled without a debugger
item.description: How to inspect arbitrary values in the memory of a .net process on Linux… And find an unexpected bug in the process.

item.title: Implementing Java ReferenceQueue and PhantomReference in C#
item.description: The Java ReferenceQueue is a mechanism that lets you know when an object has been GC’d. How hard can it be to reimplement it in .NET?
